SEARCH

Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
FileSystem
public class FileSystem extends Object
FileSystem class is the core class of the program. It contains the root directory and the current directory. It provides the main functionalities of the file system. It is responsible for adding, removing, moving, searching, listing, sorting and changing directories.

      public boolean addElement(String name, char type)
      Adds a new element to the current directory.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the element
      type - type of the element ('d' for directory, 'f' for file)
      Returns:
      true if the element is added successfully, false otherwise

      Removes an element from the current directory with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the element to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the element is removed successfully, false otherwise

    • moveElement

      public boolean moveElement(String name, String path)
      Moves an element from the current directory to the given path.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the element to be moved.
      path - path to move the element to.
      Returns:
      true if the element is moved successfully, false otherwise

    • searchElement

      public FileSystemElement searchElement(String name)
      Searches for an element with the given name starting from the root.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the element to be searched.
      Returns:
      the element if found, null otherwise.

    • changeDir

      public boolean changeDir(String path)
      Changes the current directory to the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - path to change the current directory to.
      Returns:
      true if the directory is changed successfully, false otherwise.

    • listCurrentDir

      public void listCurrentDir(String prefix)
      Lists the contents of the current directory.
      Parameters:
